p: One approach to this is to address the immense amount of food that is wasted. This category is broad, including waste at harvest, storage, processing, and a number of post-consumer pathways [ 208]. The inefficiencies above suggest that waste of animal-based foods carries a particularly high environmental cost. The FAO has estimated global food waste at about 1/3, with waste of meat products of about 20% [ 209]. Smith et al. (2013) found savings of about 6% in food crop area, and 13%â€“47% GHG savings in 2050 through waste reduction compared to the reference case [ 210].
